result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shiloe M. Viau

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 15CF-53 and 15CM-354 - Both Cases Called @ 9:50 AM: Defendant Shiloe M. Viau in court with attorney John H. Wallace.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement will call for DRI of 15CM-354 - no claim for Rest and all confiscated items have been returned.  Agreement on resolution recited by DA as to 15CF-53 with argued terms on sentencing.  Def and counsel concur w/State's recital.  Court entertains waiver of Pre-Lim hearing as to 15CF-53.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of Pre-Lim Hrg with probable cause finding.  Def BOT.  INFO Filed - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  15CF-53 Plea:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.   15CM-354 DRI.   Argument by DA as to cond'l time being imposed of 6 mos.  Stipulation as to 55 days TS credit.  Argument by Atty Wallace - ATR already implemented.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  S/W - 3 yrs probation.  Conditions:  6 mos WCJ - serve forthwith, 55 days TS credit; AODA and any follow thru as recommended;  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; NC with Spice Store in Plainfield; Court Costs with $100 Buy money - 60 DTP or PP.  Law requires that DNA sample must be provided, may already be accomplished in another felony conviction and Jailer will be able to confirm that fact.  No right to petition for expungement of DNA record due to nature of conviction.  The Court is not willing to I/S any add'l conditional time to invite another ATR with DOC.  Appeal Rights Given.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:06 p.m. Defendant Shiloe M. Viau in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Steven P. Smits.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $1000 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Smits. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 09:30 am.
